questions.title: Income inequality -- between and within countries
questions.description: Though income inequality has improved between countries﻿, 71% of the world's population lives in countries where inequality has grown. Some improvements in inequalities between men and women are seen, like on salaries that are becoming more equal.

questions.description: The world's wealth is currently concentrated at the top. Progress, like the incomes of the poorest are growing faster than the average. This offers hope for a better future. However, inequality takes many forms and varies significantly.

questions.title: Inequality is not just about money.
questions.description: Indigenous peoples, migrants, ethnic and other minorities continue to suffer from discrimination. This goes beyond income. Inequalities of opportunity can restrict a person’s human rights and limit their access to even basic resources, such as water.

questions.title: Equality and non-discrimination for all people!
questions.description: Equality and non-discrimination should be enjoyed by all people. There are no one-size-fits-all solutions, and the fight against inequality must be rooted in country-specific contexts. The UN's SDG 10 offers a good framework for this.
